issue.title: prevent resolution of external IDs
issue.body: See #410. This ensures that Rollup doesn't attempt to resolve IDs that are in `options.external`.

body:
This may be useful, but it could cause conflicts since `./dep.js` could point out any number of modules.

```
/project
  /src
    file.js
    dep.js
  index.js
  dep.js
```

Which `./dep.js` should be excluded? Any external modules must be an absolute path or an external name to avoid this ambiguity.

issue.title: Force external
issue.body:
Force ids specified in `external` to actually _be_ external.

Fixes #410
Builds on top of #417

issue.title: iife external and globals
issue.body:
Can an external be a relative import or does it have to be a node module with a package.json and main / jsnext:main?

https://github.com/rollup/rollup/wiki/JavaScript-API#external

Same question for globals, can they be relative imports somehow or are only node modules supported as globals?

https://github.com/rollup/rollup/wiki/JavaScript-API#globals

body:
This is a great point, and I think this could be considered a conflict due to a conflation of unresolved and resolved namespaces.

This can be avoided by letting the `externals` excludes act against the **resolved** module list. That is still run the `resolveId` function for possible externals, then check exclusions within the resolved namespace.

This way, we always know exactly what we are excluding as it happens in a concrete resolved namespace which is known to be unique.
Ha, we just passed each other @guybedford! Turns out great minds think alike â€“ @Victorystick implemented it exactly as you suggest.
Awesome! Thanks for your great work here :)

issue.title: Externals to still respect resolution
issue.body:
Consider the case:
- `a.js` depends on `./b.js`
- `a.js` depends on `jquery`

`resolveId` will provide the resolutions:
- `./b.js` -> `b.js`
- `jquery` -> `npm:jquery@2.1.4/dist/jquery.js`

`externals` is set to the list `['npm:jquery@2.1.4/dist/jquery.js']`.

The expected behaviour is that since `jquery` is resolved into `npm:jquery@2.1.4/dist/jquery.js` which is provided as an external, that this module would not be loaded and would inline into the build as an import to its resolved name of `npm:jquery@2.1.4/dist/jquery.js`.

The actual behaviour is that the built file contains a reference to `jquery`, the unresolved external.

Apart from that everything else is working correctly.

The idea is to provide a way to control resolution of externals in the built file. Perhaps another mechanism may be suitable for this though.

body:
I've just been poring through the code and I'm not sure if I am missing something or if even after @Victorystick's pull request, rollup errors out because it's trying to resolve a relative import that I have specifically declared to be external. Below is a self contained example (I'm running rollup 0.25.4):

```
// rollup.config.js
export default {
    entry: 'src.js',
    dest: 'bundle.js',
    external: ['./dep.js'],
}
```

```
// src.js
import dep from './dep.js';

console.log(dep)
```

```
// dep.js
export default 1;
```

My expected result is that bundle.js would have an `import` statement for `./dep.js` still. But my actual result is the following error:

```
Error: Could not resolve ./dep.js from /Users/joel/playground/test/src.js
    at /Users/joel/playground/test/node_modules/rollup/www/ROLLUP/rollup/src/Bundle.js:186:42
    at tryCatch (/Users/joel/playground/test/node_modules/rollup/www/ROLLUP/rollup/node_modules/es6-promise/lib/es6-promise/-internal.js:185:12)
    at invokeCallback (/Users/joel/playground/test/node_modules/rollup/www/ROLLUP/rollup/node_modules/es6-promise/lib/es6-promise/-internal.js:197:13)
    at publish (/Users/joel/playground/test/node_modules/rollup/www/ROLLUP/rollup/node_modules/es6-promise/lib/es6-promise/-internal.js:168:7)
    at flush (/Users/joel/playground/test/node_modules/rollup/www/ROLLUP/rollup/node_modules/es6-promise/lib/es6-promise/asap.js:87:5)
    at doNTCallback0 (node.js:407:9)
    at process._tickCallback (node.js:336:13)
    at Function.Module.runMain (module.js:477:11)
    at startup (node.js:117:18)
    at node.js:951:3
```

I am certain that all of my file paths are correct because if I comment out the `external` property, the bundle succeeds in putting `dep.js` into the bundle. I think that it has something to do with the [resolveId](https://github.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/src/Bundle.js#L33-L37) function because it [resolves `false`](https://github.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/src/Bundle.js#L34) when `./dep.js` is in the `this.externals` array, which then [fails the check](https://github.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/src/Bundle.js#L182) to determine if the module should be forced to be external.

Am I misunderstanding what @guybedford was going for with this issue or what @Victorystick was trying to do with the pull request? If so, would be happy to know why, and if not I'm happy to submit a pull request to fix it.

Ping.

If you'd prefer, I can create a new issue

@joeldenning Sorry for not getting back to you earlier. The `external` array is designed to contain the _resolved_ ids to be excluded (or the name of an external dependency); like

``` js
external: [
  'library-foo',
  path.resolve( './dep.js' )
]
```

I suppose Rollup _could_ do the `path.resolve` invocations for you, but that feature has not yet been requested nor discussed.
Ah thanks, that worked for me. Is there anywhere in the guide, wiki, or Readme that explains this? If not I'd be happy to add to the docs.
